channel.title: How do I run a Client on Windows 7?
channel.description: I have windows 7, and everytime I try to run a client it says, Windows cannot find 'java' (or 'javaw'). please locate it and try again. But when i run it in Windows XP on my other laptop, exactly the same but windows xp, it runs fine. Any ideas? Cheers.

item.title: How do I run a Client on Windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

[quote=“nardoscape, post:14, topic:327471”]1. Get the latest JDK
2. Save to Program Files
3. go to program files and click java a folder should come u[quote author=nardoscape link=topic=423859.msg3127549#msg3127549 date=1266154127]

  1. Get the latest JDK
  2. Save to Program Files
  3. go to program files and click java a folder should come up saying Jdk1._.* (something like that * = numbers)
  4. Go to your client folder.
  5. right click on the “build” and edit the Jdk type shown in there to yours. (if theres no build, try editing run)
    [/quote]p saying Jdk1._.* (something like that * = numbers)
  6. Go to your client folder.
  7. right click on the “build” and edit the Jdk type shown in there to yours. (if theres no build, try editing run)[/quote]

They are not trying to compile their client, they’re trying to run it. JDK is used to compile Java source code while JRE is used to run Java applets, programs, etc. They need JRE, not JDK.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I run a Client on Windows 7?

item.title: How do I run a Client on Windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @nardoscape nardoscape
item.description:
@nardoscape wrote:

  1. Get the latest JDK
  2. Save to Program Files
  3. go to program files and click java a folder should come up saying Jdk1._.* (something like that * = numbers)
  4. Go to your client folder.
  5. right click on the “build” and edit the Jdk type shown in there to yours. (if theres no build, try editing run)

Read full topic
item.source: How do I run a Client on Windows 7?

item.source: How do I run a Client on Windows 7?

item.title: How do I run a Client on Windows 7?
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

It’s actually not hard to run a client on Windows 7. It’s basically the same thing. If you cannot run it, my suggestion would be to use the actual class path instead of just “Java” or “Javaw”. As so:

32 Bit Operating System:

"C:\Program Files\Java\jre#\bin\java" -cp . -Xmx1024 highmem 0 client 0 0

64 Bit Operating System:

"C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre#\bin\java" -cp . -Xmx1024 highmem 0 client 0 0

Change the “#” to whatever JRE version you have. If you do not know, simply go to Start > Computer > C: > Program Files > Java > JRE version may be found in the Java file.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I run a Client on Windows 7?
